required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biomechanical Analysis of Different Landing Manoevres
clinical_study.official_title: Biomechanical Analysis of Different Landing Manoevres in Volleyball and Basketball Players

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, three-dimensional biomechanics , by means of lower limb joint angles and moments (opto-electronic system with synchronised force plate), of different landing manoevres will be compared in a population of basketball and volleyball players.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, three-dimensional biomechanics , by means of lower limb joint angles and moments (opto-electronic system with synchronised force plate), of different landing manoevres will be compared in a population of basketball and volleyball players. General as well as more sport-specific jumps will be performed in this study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: comparison between 2 different test moments separated by one week
primary_outcome.description: Knee joint moments will be extracted with an opto-electronic system and synchronised force plate

arm_group.description: Basketball and volleyball players Landing biomechanics of different landing tasks is investigated in a population of volleyball and basketball players

intervention.description: General as well as more sport-specific landing tasks are investigated with 3D analysis by using an opto-electronic system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- volleyball and basketball players
- male
Exclusion Criteria:
- history or surgery of the lower extremities
- history of fractures of the lower extremities
